content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal experience of being in Munich or browsing about unknown places. But, here are a few possible truly hidden and obscure landmarks in Munich that only locals may know about:

1. The Lost Garden - an abandoned beer garden in the Haidhausen neighborhood that has been overgrown with ivy.

2. Der Weiße Hase - a hidden bar with a vintage 1920s vibe that is tucked away in the Altstadt.

3. The Herzogpark - a lesser-known park with beautiful gardens and a lovely pond.

4. Die Schlüsselloch Bar - a quirky little bar hidden away in the Glockenbachviertel that serves up delicious cocktails.

5. The Sweet Side of Life - a hidden bakery in the Lehel neighborhood that is famous for its delicious cakes and pastries.

6. The Brunnhaus - a historic water pump house in the heart of the city that has been converted into a beautiful restaurant.

7. The Viktoria-Luise-Platz - a peaceful square in the heart of the Isarvorstadt neighborhood that is dotted with cafes and local shops.

8. The Salvator-Kirche - a beautiful church in Schwabing that is not well-known among tourists.

9. The Weissenburger Platz - a charming square in the Haidhausen neighborhood with a beautiful fountain and outdoor cafes.

10. The Heilig-Geist-Kirche - a beautiful Gothic church in the Lehel neighborhood that is often overlooked by visitors to Munich.
